intro: Sida dissecta, commonly known as the cutleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply divided into five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Sida dissecta is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
